poem:
Title: "Unseen Assault"

In unseen corridors of ones and zeros,
War played out over silicon battlefields,
A digital strike piercing healing shields,
Brings tears for those who battle Nero's.
Now the knife poised for incision,
Held hostage by codes' cruel precision.
In grey King's college, hope pushed to reminiscion,
Unleash details - reveal the untold affliction.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "London hospitals cancel cancer surgeries after cyber-attack Hospitals in London have had to cancel cancer operations this week because of a Russian cyber-attack that continues to cause serious disruption to NHS services in the capital. St Thomas’ and King’s College hospitals have postponed procedures that their surgeons were due to perform on cancer patients since the attack began last Monday, the Guardian can reveal. They have been forced to take the step because the hack". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
